passages.text: FGR, DRX, RWE, ANE, EON

- TOMORROW 
- Nothing

- FGR 
- Results in-line & guidance confirmed; no incremental positives (Research available). Overall results were in line with our expectations, with H1 EBIT at €1,006m (vs JPM e at €1,002m) and net income at €308m (JPM e €283m, but the difference is driven by surtax phasing where Eiffage reported an €83m impact on Net Income in H1 (JPM e €116m)). Considering the in line print and unchanged guidance we see limited change to consensus estimates, but expect a muted or slightly negative share price reaction tomorrow given the lack of incremental positives provided, and considering the French political overhang currently.

- DRX 
- Notification of Investigation by the Financial Conduct Authority into some historical statements on biomass sourcing. DRX announces this morning that it was notified on 26 August 2025 that the FCA has commenced an investigation into the Company covering the period January 2022 to March 2024 relating to certain historical statements regarding Drax's biomass sourcing and the compliance of Drax's 2021, 2022 and 2023 Annual Reports with the Listing Rules and Disclosure Guidance and Transparency Rules. Clearly not helpful, given this investigation has come out of the blue, but all the more surprising given Ofgem completed a lengthy investigation into DRX's biomass profiling as recently as August 2024, for which the company paid €25m, and the Government is sufficiently happy with DRX's biomass sourcing and reporting to have agreed a Bridging Mechanism in Feb this year to keep the plant running from 2027 previous close up until to 2031.

- JPM European Infrastructure, Building & Construction"Back to School" Fireside Series, Sept \(2^{\mathrm{nd}}\) - Sept \(17^{\mathrm{th}}\) , Virtual. Join our bi-annual "Back to School" Series, an event designed to provide a consolidated end-of-summer platform to take stock on key issues / catalysts into year-end, both sector and corporate. Corporates confirmed so far include CRST, FER, HEI, KSP, SGO, ADP, ROKKA, HOLN, FGR and GET and we expect to add further participants over the coming weeks. The format will be a fireide discussion moderated by J.P. Morgan research analysts; Let me know if you want the links to register.

- SAVE THE DATE - JP Morgan Global Energy Conference, Nov 3-4th, London, in-person. J.P. Morgan Global Energy Conference will take place in-person on Monday Nov 3 and Tuesday Nov 4, 2025 at J.P. Morgan's 60 Victoria Embankment offices, London EC4Y 0JP. The event will consist of an agenda addressing key energy macro, corporate and thematic topics and a full program of one-on-one/group meetings with global C-suite executives representing leading Big Energy, OFS, E&P, Utility and Renewable companies. Full details will be available shortly. In the meantime, please save the date in your calendar
Use the links below to jump straight to each section:
Company News  J.P. Morgan Access  Sector Calendar  J.P. Morgan Global Utilities & Infrastructure Contacts  Company News
- Eiffage reported H1 results after market close followed by a Management presentation.

- Overall results were in line with our expectations, with H1 EBIT at €1,006m (vs JPME at €1,002m) and net income at €308m (JPME €283m, but the difference is driven by surtax phasing where Eiffage reported an €83m impact on Net Income in H1 (JPME €116m)). Contracting EBIT was 2.4% above JPME, driven by Energy, while Concessions EBIT was 0.7% below our expectations. 
- Order book stood at €29.5bn in Jun-25 (vs. €28.4bn in Jun-24), implying order intake levels in Q2 down 8% y/y (vs. -10% in Q1).

- Net debt for the period was down at €9.9bn (vs. €10.6bn in Jun-24), and FCF was -€91m in H1 (vs. €148m in H1 24), driven by a more pronounced seasonal variation in the working capital requirement in Contracting and increased growth investment in Concession, although we note the bulk of FCF is always generated in H2.
- Eiffage also confirmed their 2025 guidance.

- Considering the in line print and unchanged guidance we see limited change to consensus estimates, but expect a muted or slightly negative share price reaction tomorrow given the lack of incremental positives provided, and considering the French political overhang currently.

- DRX announces this morning that it was notified on 26 August 2025 that the Financial Conduct Authority ("FCA") has commenced an investigation into the Company covering the period January 2022 to March 2024 relating to certain historical statements regarding Drax's biomass sourcing and the compliance of Drax's 2021, 2022 and 2023 Annual Reports with the Listing Rules and Disclosure Guidance and Transparency Rules.
- The Company will cooperate with the FCA as part of their investigation.

- Clearly not helpful, given this investigation has come out of the blue, but all the more surprising given Ofgem completed a lengthy investigation into DRX's biomass profiling as recently as August 2024, for which the company paid €25m, and the Government is sufficiently happy with DRX's biomass sourcing and reporting to have agreed a Bridging Mechanism in Feb this year to keep the plant running from 2027 previous close up until to 2031.

- It is not clear why this investigation has been launched now, but it cannot impact DRX's current ROC remuneration regime given this is overseen by Ofgem. However if it drags on then there is theoretically potential for it to delay the signing of the bridging contract for remuneration from 2027 to 2031, which is being negotiated with the Government currently and was meant to be completed around year end share price reaction tomorrow given the lack of incremental positives provided, and considering the French political overhang currently.
- Reuters reported that RWE sees no need to write down a 3GW project in the United States, its CEO said, just days after the U.S. government ordered Orsted to stop construction on an advanced site.

- No surprise given RWE and NG already discontinued work on their 73/27% split Community Offshore Wind project earlier this year after President Trump banned new offshore wind developments in the US and before an investment decision on the project has been taken. Krebber had previously said he therefore saw no need to write down the project, which has a book value of €800m, and that if political opposition persisted against the sector it could become a matter for the courts given lease payments have been made in the past.

- Renewables Now reported that Acciona Energia said on Wednesday it has reorganised its Southeast Asian operations to concentrate on the Philippines, Thailand and Vietnam, taking full control of its renewable energy pipeline in those countries. 
- The move follows a restructuring of its collaboration with Singapore-based wind power developer The Blue Circle, in which Acciona Energia is a shareholder. Under the new arrangement, Acciona Energia will manage its portfolio in the three markets, while The Blue Circle will focus independently on Sri Lanka, Malaysia and Cambodia. 
- ANE said the reorganisation strengthens its position in Asia-Pacific, a key growth region, and consolidates its presence in the
Philippines, where it has wind and solar projects at various stages of operation, construction and development. It said it plans to accelerate expansion in the country in the coming years.

- The Blue Circle, which has focused on developing wind projects in Southeast Asia, will continue to operate independently across its target markets. Acciona Energiesaid the new structure aligns with its global growth strategy and supports its aim of driving the energy transition in emerging markets. Three years ago, Acciona Energia invested \(34mn (EUR 29.3mn)\) to take a close to \(50\%\) stake in The Blue Circle and committed an additional \(113.5mn\) to finance its mature projects.

- Bloomberg reports that E.ON has issued €1.1bn green bonds – €500m 6Y (September 3, 2031) fixed with a coupon of \(3\%\) and a re-offer price of 99.67 to yield 3.061%, €600m 10Y (September 3, 2035) fixed with a coupon of 3.5% and a re-offer price of 99.14 to yield 3.604%.

Markets - The S&P went on a steady albeit wobbly grind higher to close up 24bps on light volumes tracking \(- 10\%\) vs 5dma. It was a session not too dissimilar to that of Tuesday's, in that there was little to change the narrative, with reverberations continuing from Trump/Cook as lower front end yields had Beta/Russell outperforming throughout. Today though was always going to be about NVDA, with most happy to sit on their hands until the after mkt print. Outside of that, there more of an unwindy feel today with momentum L/S in the red throughout, which felt on a combination of better than feared KSS earnings resulting in a squeezy dynamic in consumer, solid MDB earnings lending a bid to software and some pain in the crowded long semis v short software trade, alongside some likely risk off into tonight's narrative defining earnings print. Regional banks amongst the best today as the steepening dynamic gathers pace... multiple articles today honing in on the erosion of central bank independence.

- JPM European Infrastructure, Building & Construction"Back to School" Fireside Series, Sept 2nd- Sept 17th, Virtual. Join our bi-annual "Back to School" Series, an event designed to provide a consolidated end-of-summer platform to take stock on key issues / catalysts into year-end, both sector and corporate. Corporates confirmed so far include CRST, FER, HEI, KSP, SGO, ADP, ROCKA, HOLN, FGR and GET and we expect to add further participants over the coming weeks. The format will be a fireside discussion moderated by J.P. Morgan research analysts; Let me know if you want the links to register. 
- SAVE THE DATE - JP Morgan Global Energy Conference, Nov 3-4th, London, in-person. J.P. Morgan Global Energy Conference will take place in-person on Monday Nov 3 and Tuesday Nov 4, 2025 at J.P. Morgan's 60 Victoria Embankment offices, London EC4Y 0JP. The event will consist of an agenda addressing key energy macro, corporate and thematic topics and a full program of one-on-one/group meetings with global C-suite executives representing leading Big Energy, OFS, E&P, Utility and Renewable companies. Full details will be available shortly. In the meantime, please save the date in your calendar
Europe Specialist Sales  JPM | EU Utilities & Infra Daily Wire:  FGR, DRX, RWE, ANE, EON  27 August 2025

Access to any conference calls, meetings or events linked above will be, where relevant, subject to availability. These events are not suitable for retail clients but are intended for professional and institutional clients only. Equally, these events are not accessible to J.P. Morgan corporate clients, including their management teams and investor relations contacts. Some of the events referenced above will only be available to and can only be attended by High Touch clients who have subscribed to certain J.P. Morgan research packages. Any research analyst meetings will be charged for in accordance with the research pricing we have agreed with you.

All materials and information shared with you are, unless otherwise indicated to you, proprietary and confidential to J.P. Morgan. You are hereby notified that any disclosure, dissemination, copying, distribution, or use of the information provided to you, in whole or in part, other than as expressly permitted by J.P. Morgan, is STRICTLY PROHIBITED. You are permitted to disclose the materials and information to your officers and employees on a need to know basis.

If you consider the facilitation component of any of these events to be a non- monetary benefit, please contact your normal J.P. Morgan sales advisor to discuss making a payment for this service which is unbundled from any research payment. The event is intended for J.P. Morgan clients only.
If you have any questions in this regard, please contact your normal J.P. Morgan representative.
For further information in respect of non- research content please visit: https://www.jpmorgan.com/pages/disclosures/materialdisclaimer.
For disclosures and disclaimers in respect of research content please visit: https://www.jpmorgan.com/research/disclosures.
